channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for OH
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for OH

item.title: Report X-2023071006
item.description:
Report X-2023071006

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-10T21:10:13+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-12
  • City: PERRYSBURG
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: package was found on 7-12 at 1030pm in the load area, carton was wet and was brought to QA for inspection DescribePack: inner container had a missing lid which caused internal leakage DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: ppe was used to contain package in a plastic hazmat bag which was then placed in a sealed plastic tote

item.title: Report X-2023070990
item.description:
Report X-2023070990

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-10T21:10:13+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-12
  • City: GROVE CITY
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1. X-2023070990 SequenceEvent: The package was taken out of system flow due to noted spillage, upon inspection of inner contents, one of the cans was damaged during processing causing spillage, due to the spillage the rest of the contents inside the package was soiled. DescribePack: Crack container/body. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: The damaged package and contents were placed in a lined hazmat tote to mitigate spillage. 2. X-2023070997 SequenceEvent: CERTIFICATED PERSONNEL INFORMED OF DISTRESSED PACKAGE. SHIPMENT TAKEN OUT OF SYSTEM FLOW, NOTED LIQUID RELEASE CONTAINED TO PACKAGE. DISTRESSED PACKAGE CONTAINED IN A LINED HAZMAT TOTE. DescribePack: BOTTLE WAS CRUSHED FORCING LIQUID TO ESCAPE FROM CAP DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: BOTTLE WAS PLACED RIGHT SIDE UP TO MITIGATE SPILLAGE

  • Description: 1. X-2023070957 SequenceEvent: Hazmat was being loaded, package was leaking from loose closure and placed in a red lined hazmat tote DescribePack: loose closure DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: placed in red lined hazmat tote. 2. X-2023070958 SequenceEvent: Shipment removed from system flow due to noted liquid release and placed in lined hazmat tote DescribePack: closure failed on the inner bottles allowing release of the product DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: closures have been tightened and package placed in lined tote to prevent further release.

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Certified personnel were notified of a distressed package, which was pulled from the system. Leakage was contained to the box. Package was placed in a lined red tote. DescribePack: One of the handles popped out of place causing a crack to appear underneath it allowing leakage. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Pads were used soak up the liquid and placed in a lined red tote.

  • City: COLUMBUS
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On June 8, at the LCKR station reported a package that had zero markings on the outside indicating there was dangerous goods inside. The package fell off of the conveyor belt and opened up, causing the inside receptacles that are marked as a non-flammable gas to be viewed. There was no release of the gas contained in each cylinder. DG Admin instructed the station to hold the shipment until further disposition.
